profileText: A Representative from New Hampshire; born in Portsmouth, N.H., July 19, 1762; pursued classical studies and was graduated in medicine from Harvard College in 1779; practiced his profession in Portsmouth, N.H., and also engaged in mercantile pursuits; served as a ship's surgeon in the latter part of the Revolutionary War; elected as a Federalist to the Eleventh Congress (March 4, 1809-March 3, 1811); died in Portsmouth, N.H., March 13, 1831; interment in Proprietors' Burying Ground.

researchRecord.name: In the Haven family papers, 1806-1841, 71 items.
researchRecord.description: Collection includes debt judgments, mortgages, tax bills and receipts.

researchRecord.name: 1798-1820, 1 letterbook.
researchRecord.description: Business letters regarding shipping, land and financial transactions.
